passages.title: The Rise of Electric Vehicles
passages.content: Electric vehicles (EVs) have seen a dramatic rise in adoption over the past decade. While early models suffered from limited range and high costs, advances in battery technology have significantly improved efficiency and affordability. Governments worldwide are pushing for EV adoption through tax incentives and infrastructure development, with countries like Norway aiming to phase out gasoline-powered cars entirely by 2030.

questions.questionText: What is the primary focus of the passage?
answers: The technological and policy-driven rise of EVs

questions.questionText: Which factor is NOT mentioned as contributing to EV adoption?

answers: Some countries are leading in EV adoption
Gasoline prices are highest in Norway
EV technology was invented in Norway

passages.title: The Printing Press Revolution
passages.content: Johannes Gutenberg’s 15th-century printing press revolutionized communication, making books widely accessible for the first time. This invention helped spread literacy, contributed to the Protestant Reformation, and led to the rise of modern journalism. Before the printing press, books were laboriously copied by hand, limiting their availability to elites.

questions.questionText: What was one major impact of the printing press?
answers: The decline of religion in Europe
The elimination of spoken language traditions

questions.questionText: Why were books rare before the printing press?
answers: Only religious leaders were allowed to own them
They were copied by hand, making them expensive
The materials used to make books were unavailable
Was a primary goal of Gutenberg
Began declining after books became common

passages.title: Origins of the Internet
passages.content: The internet began as a military project in the 1960s, designed to ensure communication continuity during wartime. Over time, it expanded into academic institutions before becoming a global tool for commerce, entertainment, and social interaction. The creation of the World Wide Web in the 1990s made internet access user-friendly, transforming it into an indispensable part of modern life.

questions.questionText: What was the internet's original purpose?
How did the World Wide Web impact internet use?
answers: It limited access to government agencies
It made the internet easier for the general public to use

questions.questionText: The passage suggests that the internet:
answers: Was created by a single scientist
Evolved from a defense project into a global tool

passages.title: The Psychology of Procrastination
passages.content: Procrastination is not merely a matter of laziness, but a complex psychological behavior influenced by emotional regulation and fear of failure. Studies show that people procrastinate more when they associate tasks with negative emotions. Time management strategies, while helpful, often fail unless individuals address the underlying emotional factors driving procrastination.

questions.questionText: What does the passage primarily argue about procrastination?
answers: It results from deeper psychological factors
Time management can completely eliminate procrastination
It is an unavoidable human trait

questions.questionText: Which factor is mentioned as contributing to procrastination?
What does the passage suggest about time management strategies?
answers: They fail unless deeper psychological issues are addressed
They only work in structured environments

passages.title: The Role of Bees in Agriculture
passages.content: Bees play a crucial role in agriculture through pollination, enabling the reproduction of many crops. Without pollinators, food production would drastically decline. However, in recent years, bee populations have dropped due to habitat loss, pesticides, and disease. Conservation efforts are now focused on protecting natural habitats and promoting sustainable farming practices.

questions.questionText: What is the main topic of the passage?
answers: The importance of bees in agriculture

questions.questionText: Which is NOT listed as a threat to bee populations?
How are conservation efforts helping bees?
answers: By reducing the number of beekeepers
By replacing bees with mechanical pollinators

passages.title: The Concept of Artificial Intelligence
passages.content: Artificial intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines. AI systems can learn from data, recognize patterns, and make decisions. While AI enhances industries like healthcare and finance, ethical concerns remain about job displacement and decision-making biases.

answers: A method of human brain enhancement
A technology that mimics human intelligence
A type of machine used in factories

questions.questionText: Which industry is mentioned as benefiting from AI?
What concern is raised about AI?
